elements.title: Teck Lee station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Teck Lee station (pictured) opened nearly 20 years after it finished construction?

elements.title: Georgie Purcell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Georgie Purcell arranged for a trafficked greyhound to meet the Victorian minister for racing?

elements.title: concerns environmentalists (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a "sea of mega solar farms" concerns environmentalists in Kushiro, Hokkaido?

elements.title: Formula One (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Formula One drivers experience forces of up to six and a half times their body weight when cornering during a race?

elements.title: Robert Burns Memorial Statue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a member of the Irving family of New Brunswick unveiled the Robert Burns Memorial Statue in Fredericton during a rededication ceremony in 2011?

elements.title: larch dwarf mistletoe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the larch dwarf mistletoe spreads through forests by ejecting its seeds explosively at a speed of almost 100 km/h?

elements.title: a 1989 anthology of rants (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 1989 anthology of rants includes the works of left-wing and anarchist activists, far-right writers, and a murderer?

elements.title: a cemetery for formerly enslaved people (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a cemetery for formerly enslaved people in New York City is buried under a strip mall?

elements.title: Festival of Transitional Architecture (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Festival of Transitional Architecture had an event in which model cities were made out of jelly?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
